result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T Zimmerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 44 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No contact with minors without Agent's approval (only exception is minor family members).
Sex offender treatment.
No use of the internet without Agent's approval.
Not to use a computer (except for purposes of work) and with the Agent's approval.
Not to maintain any internet accounts (i.e. Facebook, Pinterest, Twitter, etc.) or access anyone elses accounts.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin T Zimmerman in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Eryn M Menden.    
State has complied with victim notification.

State moves the amend to 4th Degree Sexual Assault.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
 9  Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time
44 Days Credit
STAYED

Term of Probation:  2 Years
Concurrent to his present sentence
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No contact with minors without agent's approval (only exception is minor family members).
Sex offender treatment.
No use of the internet without agents approval.
Not to use a computer (except for purposes of work) and with the agents approval
Not to maintain any internet accounts (i.e. facebook, pinterest, twitter, etc...) or access anyone elses accounts.
DNA Sample if not already provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $200
To to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Justin T Zimmerman in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Eryn M Menden by Atty. Fragoso.
File not called on the record.    
  Hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Justin T Zimmerman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Justin T Zimmerman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
